p.s: The given excerpt of the novel The Hate U Give from Angie Thomas, published by Cornelsen 2019, is about Starr and her friends protesting for Justicejustice for Khalil and about Starr speaking to the cops, angry about KhalilsKhalil's death.
Starr, Chris, Seven and DeVante find themselvethemselves in a large crowd of people pointing hairbushes in the air.
The protest happens, where Khalil got shot and StarStarr sees the situation happening again in her thoughts.
Because of her thoughts of Khalil she and her friend scream what the crowd screams: A hairbrush is not a gun (l. 20).
She meets her attornyattorney who is protesting with a bullhorn (ll. 24-25).
They talk about StarrsStarr's need to do something for Khalil (l. 30) so her Attorneyattorney Ms. Ofrah, lets her use the bullhorn (ll. 38-39).
At first Starr is not sure what to say, but the crowd and Ms. Ofrah cheer her up (l. 46).
So she starts speaking to the crowd (l. 51).
She says what she always wanted to say, that the fact that Khalil lived is important, not how he died (ll. 59-61).
